force:limits:api:display.description:
display current orgâ€™s limits
When you execute this command in a project, it provides limit information for your default scratch org.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

force:limits:recordcounts:display.description:
display record counts for the specified standard and custom objects
Use this command to get an approximate count of the records in standard or custom objects in your org. These record counts are the same as the counts listed in the Storage Usage page in Setup. The record counts are approximate because they're calculated asynchronously and your org's storage usage isn't updated immediately. To display all available record counts, run the command without the '--sobjecttype' parameter.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

sobjecttype.name: sobjecttype
sobjecttype.description: comma-separated list of API names of standard or custom objects for which to display record counts
